New Records: The Knicks missed 18 out of 22 three-point attempts, the lowest success rate in a single game this season.
The Knicks have lost three consecutive games for the first time this season.
Key Match Events: The Magic's makeshift lineup, including Cole Anthony, Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, and Wendell Carter Jr., performed well from the three-point line, making 9 out of 11 attempts.
Pre-Game Insights: Josh Hart emphasized the need for the team to stay focused and avoid individual agendas.
Jalen Brunson expressed frustration with the team's lack of three-point shooting.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks are one of six teams with a.500 or better record when hitting 10 or fewer three-pointers, highlighting their ability to perform without relying solely on three-pointers.
The loss marked the start of a 14-game homestand for the Knicks.
Others: The Knicks are set to face the Toronto Raptors in their next game.
